Selecting an Evaluation Metric for Race and Ethnicity Imputation in FARS

title: Selecting an Evaluation Metric for Race and Ethnicity Imputation in FARS
text:
In machine learning, the evaluation metric is a crucial component of the model development process. The evaluation metric is used to assess the performance of a model and determine how well it is performing on a given task. The choice of evaluation metric can have a significant impact on the model results. Here, I provide an overview of how I selected the evaluation metric for the imputation model that predicts the race and ethnicity of people in the Fatality Analysis Reporting System.
The multiclass receiver operating characteristic area under the curve (mROCAUC) is selected for the race and ethnicity imputation model because it aligns with the disparity estimation objective of the study.

title: Selecting an Evaluation Metric for Race and Ethnicity Imputation in FARS
text:
Decription of the model objective

Output will be used to compare outcomes between racial and ethnic groups

Ex. \(p(DrugTest) \sim \beta_0 + \beta_1 Racenicity + \epsilon\)

Out performance metric needs to align with the intended use of the model

Goal: minimize systematic missclassifications
\(MROC_{AUC} = \frac{1}{C \times (C - 1)} \sum_{i=0}^{C-1} \sum_{j=0, j \neq i}^{C-1} A(i,j)\)
Calculate Average discriminatory power of White v Black, White v Hispanic, White v Other
Iterate for all race and ethnicity classes
Take the average of these averages

title: Selecting an Evaluation Metric for Race and Ethnicity Imputation in FARS
section: Why selecting an evaluation metric should align with the research question
